text: <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activates the expression of MHC class II genes in mouse T cells .

It has long been a puzzle that MHC class II molecules are expressed in human T cells after activation but not in mouse T cells ; this expression is believed to play a role in the cell mediated immune response .

Recently the <extra_id_0> MHC class II transactivator <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) has been reported to be a major regulatory factor for both the constitutive and IFN inducible expression of MHC class II genes .
Here we show that human T cells expressing MHC class II have <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcripts while MHC class II - negative human T cells and mouse T cells do not .
The expression of MHC class II genes in mouse T cells can be reconstituted upon transfection with the human <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cDNA .

text: These data indicate that the expression of <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> explains the expression or lack of expression of MHC class II in human and mouse T cells respectively .
